repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Specifically, functions that are run in the context of the test runner
are put in module `test/testutil.lua` while the functions that are run
in the context of the test session are put in
`test/functional/testnvim.lua`.

Closes https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/27004.

comment_data.body: I thought this was maybe an accidental search-replace. But now I see this might be *fixing* an accidental replace.
This file doesn't not exist on this commit.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -119,7 +122,7 @@ Debugging tests
   If `$VALGRIND` is also set it will pass `--vgdb=yes` to valgrind instead of
   starting gdbserver directly.
 
-  See [test/functional/testutil.lua](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/9cadbf1d36b63f53f0de48c8c5ff6c752ff05d70/test/functional/testutil.lua#L52-L69) for details.
+  See [test/functional/nvimsession.lua](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/9cadbf1d36b63f53f0de48c8c5ff6c752ff05d70/test/functional/nvimsession.lua#L52-L69) for details.

comment_data.body: And there is another instance in `runtime/doc/dev_tools.txt`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -119,7 +122,7 @@ Debugging tests
   If `$VALGRIND` is also set it will pass `--vgdb=yes` to valgrind instead of
   starting gdbserver directly.
 
-  See [test/functional/testutil.lua](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/9cadbf1d36b63f53f0de48c8c5ff6c752ff05d70/test/functional/testutil.lua#L52-L69) for details.
+  See [test/functional/nvimsession.lua](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/9cadbf1d36b63f53f0de48c8c5ff6c752ff05d70/test/functional/nvimsession.lua#L52-L69) for details.

comment_data.body:
Calling the returned function here doesn't do anything.
```suggestion
local n = require('test.functional.nvimsession')
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
 -- Modules loaded here will not be cleared and reloaded by Busted.
 -- Busted started doing this to help provide more isolation.  See issue #62
 -- for more information about this.
-local t = require('test.functional.testutil')
+local n = require('test.functional.nvimsession')()

@@ -119,7 +122,7 @@ Debugging tests
   If `$VALGRIND` is also set it will pass `--vgdb=yes` to valgrind instead of
   starting gdbserver directly.
 
-  See [test/functional/testutil.lua](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/9cadbf1d36b63f53f0de48c8c5ff6c752ff05d70/test/functional/testutil.lua#L52-L69) for details.
+  See [test/functional/nvimsession.lua](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/9cadbf1d36b63f53f0de48c8c5ff6c752ff05d70/test/functional/nvimsession.lua#L52-L69) for details.

comment_data.body:
the URL was broken but we could fix it: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/a4fc3bb0e68c8b078377fd9826e4cca3b4b3fdbf/test/functional/testutil.lua#L29-L51

or mention "see nvim_argv in ..."
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -88,8 +88,6 @@ Then, in another terminal:
     gdb build/bin/nvim
     target remote localhost:7777
 <
-- See also test/functional/testutil.lua https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/3098b18a2b63a841351f6d5e3697cb69db3035ef/test/functional/testutil.lua#L38-L44.

comment_data.body: looks wrong. but we can delete this file anyway

```suggestion
  test session (RPC channel to the Nvim child process created by clear() for each test)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -37,18 +37,21 @@ Layout
 - `/test/benchmark` : benchmarks
 - `/test/functional` : functional tests
 - `/test/unit` : unit tests
+- `/test/old/testdir` : old tests (from Vim)
 - `/test/config` : contains `*.in` files which are transformed into `*.lua`
   files using `configure_file` CMake command: this is for accessing CMake
   variables in lua tests.
 - `/test/includes` : include-files for use by luajit `ffi.cdef` C definitions
   parser: normally used to make macros not accessible via this mechanism
   accessible the other way.
 - `/test/*/preload.lua` : modules preloaded by busted `--helper` option
-- `/test/**/testutil.lua` : common utility functions for test code
+- `/test/**/testutil.lua` : common utility functions in the context of the test
+  runner
+- `/test/**/nvimsession.lua` : common utility functions in the context of the
+  test session

comment_data.body: We haven't merged this PR yet, how could we refer to a commit hash that hasn't been created?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -88,8 +88,6 @@ Then, in another terminal:
     gdb build/bin/nvim
     target remote localhost:7777
 <
-- See also test/functional/testutil.lua https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/3098b18a2b63a841351f6d5e3697cb69db3035ef/test/functional/testutil.lua#L38-L44.

comment_data.body: Since we no longer merge the modules, this makes it obvious that this test doesn't use a Nvim session.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-" Also used by: test/functional/testutil.lua
+" Also used by: test/functional/nvimsessions.lua

comment_data.body: I'll go ahead with the "see nvim_argv in ..." option
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -88,8 +88,6 @@ Then, in another terminal:
     gdb build/bin/nvim
     target remote localhost:7777
 <
-- See also test/functional/testutil.lua https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/3098b18a2b63a841351f6d5e3697cb69db3035ef/test/functional/testutil.lua#L38-L44.

comment_regular_data.body:
>  (already done?) See if we can convince LuaLS to show a docstring when LSP hover doc (K) is used on the n variable.

Technically I guess? When you press `K` the description is hidden since it's written last and there are so many functions in the module.
